definition:
If $(G,*)$ is a group then any subgroup of order $p^a$ for any integer a
is called a *p-subgroup*. If $|G|=p^am$, where $p\nmid m$ then any
subgroup $S$ of $G$ with $|S|=p^a$ is a *Sylow p-subgroup*. We use
${\rm Syl_p}(G)$ for the set of Sylow p-groups of $G$.

More generally, if $G$ is any group (not necessarily finite), a Sylow
p-subgroup is a maximal $p$-subgroup of $G$.
